folder: Tillary St. & Jay St., Brooklyn, NY
text:
Tillary Street, west from Jay Street, showing more of the south side of the street. The 6-story white building is the Brooklyn Edison Company Building, at Pearl Street, and beyond that, across the "El," is a corner of the United States Post Office. In the left background is the Montague-Court Building.

View 1: June 2, 1931
View 2: September 9, 1939

View 1 shows the S.E. corner of Tillary and Jay Streets, Tillary being on the left, standing to Lawrence Street; Jay Street is on the right. The cleared area is the same as that seen on the right in view 1, where the building was razed.

P. L. Sperr

folder: Tillary St. & Jay St., Brooklyn, NY
text:
Tillary Street, east across Jay Street. One the left is McLaughlin Park.

P.L. Sperr.

September 9, 1939
